page.title: 05WARBLINGTON SCHOOL BUILDING
page.content: Warblington School's main building is the{only one of it's kind}in Britain. Built as an experiment in the early 50s by Bristol Aircraft Co. it is made of Alclad. A similar one in Coventry has been destroyed by acid rain. There are three other blocks ,a sports hall and a swimming pool (out of doors). The whole school is laid out on the east end of a large sports field, facing Southleigh Road.To the north there is the Portsmouth-London railway line. The main block is three stories high and except for a gas tank to the north and some flats to the north-west,it is the tallest building in the area.In a Havant Conservation Report of 1974 the thirty-three year old dull grey building was said to be an eyesore, and more should be done to screen it.
